titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Audiovisual Materials, Lectures and Assorted Events
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Audiovisual Materials, Lectures and Assorted Events FA954

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-10-14 14:54:13 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Audiovisual Materials, Lectures and Assorted Events

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audio visual material consists of tapes, cassettes and film reels.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

All inquiries to view films require advanced notice of at least 48 business hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may require creation of an access surrogate. Applicable charges will apply.

did.unittitle: The Rockefeller Hospital Reunion Celebration. 75 Years of Clinical Research

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes: Joshua Lederberg, "Welcome from The Rockefeller University", Attallah Kappas, "Welcome from The Rockefeller University Hospital", Vincent P. Dole, "Presentation of Conferring Honorary Doctor of Science to Jacques Genest", Igor Tamm, "Presentation of Conferring Honorary Doctor of Science to Edwin D. Kilbourne", Lewis Thomas, "Clinical Research As Basic Science", David Baltimore, "Has Molecular Medicine Come of Age?", Bengt Borgström, "The Art of Intestinal Intubation and Its Importance for Basic and Clinical Research", David H. Blankenhorn, "Measurement of Atherosclerosis in Living Man: Implications for Prevention and Therapy", Elliot S. Vesell, "Pharmacogenetics: The Individual Factor in Drug Response", Harold S. Ginsberg, "Adenoviruses: Agents of "Polypathogenic" Infections".
